about.description:
At the core of DAMASK is a flexible and hierarchically structured
model of material point behavior for the solution of elastoplastic
boundary value problems along with damage and thermal physics. Its
main purpose is the simulation of crystal plasticity within a
finite-strain continuum mechanical framework.

name: damask-grid
raw_recipe:
# This file created by conda-build 3.21.8
# ------------------------------------------------

package:
  name: damask-grid
  version: 3.0.0a6
source:
  patches:
    - MPICH.patch
    - PETSc-HDF5-Fortran.patch
  sha256: de6748c285558dec8f730c4301bfa56b4078c130ff80e3095faf76202f8d2109
  url: https://damask.mpie.de/download/damask-3.0.0-alpha6.tar.xz
build:
  number: 0
  run_exports:
    - hdf5
    - mpich
    - petsc
  script:
    - PETSC_DIR=${PREFIX} cmake -B build-grid -DDAMASK_SOLVER=grid -DCMAKE_INSTALL_PREFIX=${PREFIX}
    - cmake --build build-grid --target install
  string: h2f6bc10_0

    - hdf5 >=1.12.1,<1.12.2.0a0 mpi_mpich_*

    - libgfortran-ng
    - libgfortran5 >=10.3.0

    - petsc >=3.16.1,<3.17.0a0
  run_constrained:
    - damask ==3.0.0a6
test:
  commands:
    - export OMPI_MCA_plm=isolated
    - export OMPI_MCA_btl_vader_single_copy_mechanism=none
    - export OMP_NUM_THREADS=2
    - DAMASK_grid --help
about:
  description: 'At the core of DAMASK is a flexible and hierarchically structured

    model of material point behavior for the solution of elastoplastic

    boundary value problems along with damage and thermal physics. Its

    main purpose is the simulation of crystal plasticity within a

    finite-strain continuum mechanical framework.

    '
  dev_url: https://damask.mpie.de/development
  doc_url: https://damask.mpie.de/documentation
  home: https://damask.mpie.de/
  license: AGPL-3.0-or-later
  license_file:
    - COPYING
    - LICENSE
  summary: Duesseldorf Advanced Material Simulation Kit
extra:
  copy_test_source_files: true
  final: true
  recipe-maintainers:
    - MarDiehl
    - jan-janssen
    - yangbai90

about.description:
At the core of DAMASK is a flexible and hierarchically structured
model of material point behavior for the solution of elastoplastic
boundary value problems along with damage and thermal physics. Its
main purpose is the simulation of crystal plasticity within a
finite-strain continuum mechanical framework.
